ai.summary: Braan Path is a 14.3 km moderate hike in the UK, weaving along forest trails and ridges to showcase cascading waterfalls and scenic viewpoints along the Braan River.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines forest paths, rocky ridges, and occasional boardwalk sections. Expect uneven ground with roots and minor elevation gain; trails near waterfalls can be damp and slippery.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy boots and weather-appropriate clothing. Stay on marked paths, especially near waterfalls where rocks can be slick. Check local conditions for closures or muddy stretches. Carry a map or GPS, sufficient water, and inform someone of your plans; keep dogs on a leash if required.
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn offer comfortable weather and vivid scenery; summer provides longer daylight, while winter requires extra preparation and can bring closures.
